title: Alt Gr stops working after terminal reconnection
author: telecotxesco
body_snippet:
Alt Gr key stops working over the rest of the opened applications outside mRemoteNG, not being able to type special characters like "@", "Γé¼", etc.

## Expected Behavior
Alt Gr key to work as usual.

## Current Behavior
Alt Gr key stop working and has no efect after remote desktop connection is lost and reconnected.

## Possible Solution
I guess there is something on reconnection scenario that makes keyboard mess.

## Context
nRemoteNG with active Windows Servers Remote desktops con...

comments.snippet: Was the RDP connection in full-screen mode or normal size?
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: Normal size. mRemoteNG windowed but maximized, and the RDP inside the right tabbed panel. Connections panel fixed on left.
comments.author: telecotxesco

comments.snippet:
Had similar issue, but not linked with mremote (issue with and without mremote), probably with RDP itself. Found a workaround :
Go in a RDP session (or open a new one) and press-release Alt-Gr in that session. Then it works back normal.
comments.author: Pouet78

comments.snippet:
Try this :
On the remote desktop, open the task manager and start a new task "explorer.exe"
This solved the issue on my computer.
comments.author: dev-indb

comments.snippet: When I do have that issue I just reconnect all windows sessions I have open at the time (it's a pain, but works). I encountered this issue also with other tools when using RDP (including mstsc.exe itself), I'm not sure mRemoteNG can do much here...
